decks.notes: This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. Using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory to control the board, the deck looks to quickly close out the game with powerful creatures like Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Quantum Riddler. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to handle threats from the opponent. The mana base is built to support the various colors needed for the deck's spells and abilities, allowing for flexibility in casting spells efficiently.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes key support cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Guide of Souls to maintain board presence and generate value. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah serves as a strong finisher, while cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment provide additional reach. The deck also includes disruption elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and close out games quickly.

This Amulet Titan deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana through land acceleration and utilizing Primeval Titan to fetch key lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. By combining the abilities of Amulet of Vigor and bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber, the deck aims to create explosive turns where Primeval Titan can search for additional lands, enabling combos like Scapeshift. Additionally, cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Stock Up provide additional tutoring and card draw to help assemble the combo pieces needed for victory.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide array of artifact creatures onto the battlefield, utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to generate mana and card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, supported by efficient removal options like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke. Urza's Saga is used to tutor for key artifacts, while Emry, Lurker of the Loch provides recursion and additional value. The deck aims to close out games quickly through efficient card draw and powerful synergy between its artifact creatures and spells.

The main focus of this Amulet Titan deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate large amounts of mana quickly. By combining ramp cards like Arboreal Grazer and Green Sun's Zenith with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift, the deck can quickly assemble a lethal board presence or combo finish. The deck also includes utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to help search for key combo pieces and protect against counterspells. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combination of ramp, land tutoring, and creature threats.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and aggressive creatures, while also utilizing powerful Planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls. The deck includes a mix of creatures with strong abilities, such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, paired with removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to control the battlefield. Additionally, cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Goblin Bombardment provide additional value and reach to close out the game quickly. The inclusion of Blood Moon helps disrupt opponent's mana base, while also providing flexibility with Elegant Parlor.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal. It also utilizes disruptive creatures like Ragavan and Kaito to pressure the opponent and generate card advantage. Tamiyo and Quantum Riddler provide card selection and advantage, while Psychic Frog can be a powerful recursive threat. The mana base is designed to support the deck's casting requirements and includes fetch lands to thin the deck and enable Delirium for Unholy Heat. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can secure a win condition or outvalue the opponent.

The deck focuses on generating mana and casting powerful creatures quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, all while maintaining a strong mana base with a mix of fetch lands and utility lands. With a strong focus on tempo and resource denial, the deck looks to control the battlefield and close out the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature play with a mix of powerful spells to control the board and disrupt opponents. By utilizing a variety of mana sources, it aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of strong creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while also providing protection with cards like Stubborn Denial. The inclusion of Leyline cards and Teferi, Time Raveler adds an extra layer of control and disruption, making it a versatile and adaptable deck in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor, in order to power out big threats like Primeval Titan and use combo pieces like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble to overwhelm opponents. The deck also utilizes land synergies with cards like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber to generate value and create advantageous board states. Additionally, Urza's Saga provides additional utility and value throughout the game.

The main concept of this Landless Combo deck is to use cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect to generate mana and control the board while setting up for a game-winning combo with Goblin Charbelcher. The deck focuses on disrupting your opponent with counterspells like Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation, while searching for key combo pieces using cards like Whir of Invention and Waterlogged Teachings. Additionally, cards like Jwari Disruption and Sink into Stupor help control the game and buy time for the combo to come together.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and graveyard interactions to quickly flood the board with threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining aggressive creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Pinnacle Emissary with artifact ramp and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and control the game tempo. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga, along with counterspells and graveyard hate, provides a versatile and adaptable strategy that can adapt to different matchups.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through various rituals and medallions to cast a big spell like Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to the opponent. It includes cards that help with card draw and digging through the deck to find combo pieces, as well as ways to recur key spells from the graveyard. The deck also includes a wish package to tutor for specific cards needed for the combo. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to generate mana quickly and efficiently to set up a game-winning combo.

The key strategy of this UW Control deck is to maintain board control through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. It aims to control the pace of the game by disrupting opponents' plans while building up its own resources. The inclusion of companions like Kaheera, the Orphanguard adds an additional layer of synergy to the deck. By effectively managing threats and resources, this deck seeks to outvalue opponents and ultimately secure a victory through careful plays and calculated decisions.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using Birthing Ritual and Coiling Oracle, Ice-Fang Coatl, and Shardless Agent to control the board. Subtlety and other counter spells are used to disrupt the opponent's plan. The deck also includes creatures like Endurance and Harbinger of the Seas for additional disruption. Overall, the key strategy involves fast ramping, board control, and disruption to overwhelm the opponent in a quick and efficient manner.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter provide additional aggression and disruption. The deck includes instant and sorcery spells like Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt to control the board and finish off opponents. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card advantage and selection. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to apply pressure early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures such as Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It also includes cards like Doorkeeper Thrull, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Territorial Kavu to maintain board presence and deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes various spells like Lightning Bolt, Stubborn Denial, and Consign to Memory for removal and disruption. Additionally, cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional control and protection for the creatures. The mana base is designed to support the diverse color requirements of the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with low-cost artifact creatures and utilize cards like Arcbound Ravager and Engineered Explosives to control the battlefield. By taking advantage of artifacts like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, the deck aims to generate mana quickly to play big threats like Pinnacle Emissary. The inclusion of cards like Tormod's Crypt also allows for disruption against graveyard-based strategies. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast plays and efficient use of resources to secure a victory.

The deck revolves around quickly assembling the Allosaurus Combo by utilizing cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to tutor for specific creatures. With cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer for protection, the deck aims to get Allosaurus Rider onto the battlefield alongside Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant or other powerful creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes Planar Genesis to ramp up mana production and generate advantage. Overall, the key strategy is to efficiently combo off while maintaining control and tempo in the game.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Arboreal Grazer to cast powerful spells like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. By utilizing land tutors like Green Sun's Zenith and Urza's Saga, the deck can efficiently set up powerful combos and quickly win the game through overwhelming board presence or direct damage. The inclusion of utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Lotus Field provide additional flexibility and protection for the deck's key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the Amulet Titan combo, which allows the player to quickly ramp up their mana and cheat out powerful creatures like Primeval Titan. It utilizes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to accelerate mana production and trigger powerful land abilities. The deck also includes cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key pieces of the combo. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and strong land interactions to achieve a quick victory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. Utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional threats and ways to close out the game. The deck also has some minor disruptive elements with cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The primary focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive approach, utilizing creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride to deal quick damage. The deck also includes control elements like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer provide support and card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison further strengthens the deck's ability to control the battlefield and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards such as Solitude and Consign to Memory. The deck utilizes powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Quantum Riddler to pressure the opponent while also having strong interaction with cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Prismatic Ending. The deck also has some versatility with cards like Ephemerate and No More Lies to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and disrupt the opponent's plans while applying pressure to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Teferi, Time Raveler helps control the board and protect your own threats. The deck also includes card advantage with Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Consign to Memory. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for the deck to operate smoothly and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and medallions, allowing for explosive plays and combo potential with cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot. The deck also utilizes past in flames to recur spells from the graveyard and maximize the value of each card played. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Wrenn's Resolve and Valakut Awakening to help filter through the deck and find key pieces needed to win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Simic Birthing Ritual card in order to ramp up mana quickly and deploy threats efficiently. The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures such as Abhorrent Oculus, Coiling Oracle, and Ice-Fang Coatl to apply pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive cards like Subtlety and Endurance to control the board and protect its own creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient mana generation.

The deck focuses on using Birthing Ritual to ramp up mana quickly, allowing for the aggressive creature base to come out quickly and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes powerful control elements in the form of counterspells and disruption. By utilizing a mix of card advantage and tempo plays, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while simultaneously disrupting their game plan. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to efficiently play threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Birthing Ritual and powerful creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Ice-Fang Coatl to overwhelm opponents. It also includes disruption spells like Sink into Stupor and Flare of Denial to control the board while maintaining pressure. Additionally, the deck features a mix of card advantage and tempo with cards like Coiling Oracle and Shardless Agent. The inclusion of powerful lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and varied creature types like Quantum Riddler adds versatility to the strategy. Overall, the deck aims to play aggressively while maintaining control of the game.

This deck focuses on playing creatures with flash and disruption spells to control the opponent's board while accelerating its own game plan through the use of Birthing Ritual. By constantly putting pressure on the opponent and disrupting their plays, the deck aims to overwhelm them before they can establish a solid defense. With a mix of card draw, counterspells, and creatures with powerful abilities, this deck aims to outmaneuver and outvalue the opponent to achieve victory in a fast-paced, aggressive manner.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with various cheap spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter to maintain pressure on the opponent. Mishra's Bauble provides card advantage, while Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart offer direct damage. The deck aims to win quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures, while also disrupting their plans with cards like Surgical Extraction.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through powerful artifacts and Eldrazi creatures while ramping up mana with Urza lands. Karn, the Great Creator and Chalice of the Void help disrupt opponent's strategies, while Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and All Is Dust provide board wipes. The deck also utilizes Eldrazi creatures like Sire of Seven Deaths and Devourer of Destiny to apply pressure and close out games. The combination of control elements, powerful creatures, and mana acceleration makes this deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.
